a.strong: A video message from Dr. Phipps

div.p: A message from Dr. Phipps-
Good evening,
Gov. Henry McMaster and state Superintendent of Education Molly Spearman announced today that all schools will remain closed through the end of the school year.
We are thankful to our teachers, students and families for the excellent job each of you have done over the past six weeks and in the weeks ahead adjusting to distance learning.
All buildings will continue to be closed.
We understand that there are questions and concerns about todayâ€™s announcement.We are working on plans for graduations and ceremonies. As soon as the details are finalized, we will send that out.
Please continue to stay healthy and safe.

-Jonathan Phipps
__________________________________________________
Governor McMaster & Superintendent Spearman announced that all SC public schools are closed for the remainder of the school year.
Plans for graduation and other ceremonies will be announced next week.

More details will be posted as they are available.
__________________________________________________
Wednesday, April 8 reminders

â€¢Packet 2 distribution
â€“ Learning packet 2 will be available tomorrow, Thursday, April 9 at your school from 12-5 p.m., some schools have added extended hours before or after. Check your school communication for additional information.
â€“ You may access the packet online Virtual Learning Days
â€“ Packet 2 for elementary may be accessed through the District website and school websites. Middle will be accessed through the school and district website and High School will be accessed through your teacher online.
â€“ When you pick up packet 2, you should also drop off packet 1. Please make sure that packet 1 has your studentâ€™s name, grade and teacher. Also, you can put the packet back in the envelope it came in or in a Ziplock bag, etc. to make sure that it stays together. If your student needs more time on packet 1, it can be turned in at a later time.

â€¢ Spring Break
â€“ Spring Break will still be April 10 through April 19, 2020 for students, teachers and staff. Teachers will be available again on Monday, April 20, 2020.

â€¢ Meals
â€“ Meals for the week of Spring Break, April 13-17 will be distributed Friday, April 10 from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. There WILL NOT be meal distribution on Monday, April 13.
â€“ Meal distribution will resume on Monday, April 20 from 11 a.m.-1 p.m.
__________________________________________________

br.br:
Meals for the week of Spring Break, April 13-17 will be distributed Friday, April 10 from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. There WILL NOT be meal distribution on Monday, April 13.
Meal distribution will resume on Monday, April 20 from 11 a.m.-1 p.m.
__________________________________________________
Thursday, April 2 update

p.br: Packet 2 can be picked up Thursday, April 9 from 12 â€“ 5p.m. at your school. Packet 1 should be dropped off at the same time of picking up Packet 2.

div.p: Packet 2 will also be online if you are not able to pick it up on Thursday, April 9. Packet 2 for elementary may be accessed through the District website and school websites on April 9. Middle will be accessed through the district website and High will be accessed through your teacher on April 9.

p.br: Spring Break will still be April 10-19 for students, teachers and staff. Teachers will be available again on April 20.

br.br: There was more participation than expected this week from the previous week. The 5 sites will be open Monday 11 a.m. -1 p.m. Students should be in the vehicle when food is picked up. SROs (Law enforcement) will be added to the feeding sites next week for added security as some participants were caught visiting multiple locations which greatly impacted our estimates.

div.p:
The 5 sites are as follows:
â€¢Â Â Â Â Â Andrew Jackson High
â€¢Â Â Â Â Â Buford High
â€¢Â Â Â Â Â Lancaster High
â€¢Â Â Â Â Â AR Rucker Middle
â€¢Â Â Â Â Â South Middle

It has been an added challenge in ordering the food as some items are not being delivered. HOPE in Lancaster is also giving out food for those who may need assistance. When we receive calls we are helping folks find resources such as HOPE or Transformation Church to have needed resources.

Wednesday, March 25, meal distribution begins at Indian Land High School, 11 a.m. â€“ 1 p.m. for qualifying students in the Indian Land area. The student who qualifies for free or reduced priced meals must be present in order to pick up meals.
3 days of food will be provided in one bag. After this week, food for 5 days (5 lunch and 5 breakfasts) will be regularly distributed on Mondayâ€™s from 11 a.m. â€“ 1 p.m.

__________________________________________________
â€“Field Trip refunds
Wednesday, March 25 update
The first round of refunds was processed last week (3/18). This round included 510 checks totaling over $32,000. There are 569 refunds keyed for payment next Monday (3/30) totaling nearly $30,000. The focus has been on the highest dollar refunds first since those will have the most impact on families that may be struggling now.
Refunds continue to be processed as they are submitted by the schools.
Please check with your school if you have any questions about your refund. Thank you for your patience since the refunds may take longer than usual due to the volume being processed.

__________________________________________________
â€“Tuesday, March 23
Governor McMaster announced that all SC public schools will remain closed until April 30.
Parents will be notified by the district soon regarding upcoming student assignments.
More details will be posted as they are available.

__________________________________________________
â€“Comporium provides internet for 60 days
Comporium is offering 60 days of free Standard HSI service and free installation to new customers in homes where a student lives.

â€¢Â Â Â Â Â The primary home of a student in kindergarten through high school, in technical school, in college, or in graduate school;
â€¢Â Â Â Â Â Currently without our internet service and that hasnâ€™t had internet service with Comporium for the past 90 days; and
â€¢Â Â Â Â Â Located where Comporium would normally provide internet service.
Comporium is also waiving installation fees and normal security deposit process during this time. Comporium plans to keep this opportunity available to new customers through the end of March and will reevaluate it at that time.
